title: Agenda
text: About this site

title: Connect, Compute and Communicate!
text:
The Internet of Things (IoT) is perceived as a collection of smart, connected devices with the ability to send and receive data; “internet” encapsulates connectivity and “things” are devices (electronic or mechanical) that can be adapted toward connectivity. There is an alternative perception of IoT, as a design methodology that facilitates interoperability and connectivity of physical systems. Edge computing is a strategy for localized analysis of data, ahead in the pipeline of powerful data center- or cloud-based post-processing.
This workshop provides an introductory-level exposure of the IoT framework and expands it with edge computing ideology via practical and hands-on exposure. The attendees will be exposed to the IoT framework using sensors, IoT automation and connectivity in a “microLab” environment that includes the Raspberry Pi (single-board computer) and Python programming language. The attendees will be expected to bring their own laptops with a free version of RealVNC Viewer software downloaded and installed. The attendees will work in small groups using a limited number of hardware components and WiFi connectivity that will be provided.
The workshop will facilitate learning about how IoT with edge computing capability is going to be the backbone of the Industry 4.0.

title: Instruction Team
text:
Dr. Kartik V. Bulusu is an Associate Research Professor in the Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE).
His research work entails human health and sustainable energy with a focus on biofluid mechanics, polymer rheology, low-cost energy technologies, and applications of wavelet transforms.
He is also working on AI-on-the-edge applications using low-power devices. In his free time, he loves to tinker with electronics and design low-cost experiments for research and education.
Dr. Bulusu has been developing low-cost ejector technologies refrigeration in disaster-prone regions and humanitarian needs.
Office Hours: On-Demand (Please reach out via email)
Location: Blackboard Collaborate Course Room
Campus Address: SEH 3000
Email: bulusu@email.gwu.edu

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Mac
text:
RealVNC is a remote desktop software that allows you to access your computer from anywhere. Follow the steps below to establish a remote using RealVNC on your Windows computer.


Before you begin, ensure that you have already installed RealVNC on your Mac.





Launch VNC Viewer from Start. If prompted to Log in/Sign Up hit “Cancel”, you’re NOT REQUIRED to sign up.



Open RealVNC Viewer





Don’t Sign up





To connect to a Raspberry Pi, launch RealVNC Viewer, enter the IP address on the box into the address bar, and hit Enter. You may need to enter the login credentials for the Raspberry Pi.



IP Address on the Box





Connect to the Pi





Enter Credentials





You are now connected to the Raspberry Pi, and you can control it.



Remote Connection Successfull





To disconnect from the Raspberry Pi, simply close the VNC Viewer window.




You have successfully established connection to the Pi, allowing you to access and control it with ease.
For more information and support, you can visit the RealVNC website.

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Mac
text: RealVNC is a remote desktop software that allows you to access your computer from anywhere. Follow the steps below to install RealVNC on your macOS.

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Mac
text:
Prerequisites
Before you begin, ensure that you have administrative privileges on your Mac.

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Mac
text:
Installation Steps

1. Download RealVNC Viewer
Visit the RealVNC Viewer download page at https://www.realvnc.com/en/connect/download/combined/ and click on the “Download for macOS” button to download the installer.



Downlaod RealVNC




2. Install RealVNC Viewer:
Locate the downloaded installer file (usually in your Downloads folder) and double-click on it to start the installation process and click on “Allow” when prompted.



Run Installer





Allow Installation




3. Follow Installation Wizard
The installation wizard will guide you through the installation process. Click on “Customize installation” and “Deselect RealVNC Server” and hit “Install”.



Customize Installation





Deselect RealVNC Server




4. Launch RealVNC Viewer
Once the installation is complete, you can launch RealVNC Viewer by clicking on the “Launch” button or launch it from Launchpad. If prompted to Log in/Sign Up hit “Cancel”, you’re NOT REQUIRED to sign up.



Open RealVNC





Don’t Sign up

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Mac
text:
Conclusion
You have successfully installed RealVNC Viewer on your Mac, allowing you to access and control remote computers with ease.
For more information and support, you can visit the RealVNC website.

title: Instruction Team
text:
Dr. Kartik V. Bulusu is an Associate Research Professor in the Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering at The George Washington University, Washington DC.
He designed taught a cross-disciplinary course titled, Internet of Things (IoT) and Edge Computing with applications in cyber-physical systems and speech processing. In addition, he developed courses for first year engineering students on the engineering applications of Raspberry Pi, Python programming and mobile App development inspired by social innovation potential during the COVID-19 pandemic. His research interests span the areas of human health and sustainable energy with focus on mechanics of biological fluids, low-cost energy technologies and applications of wavelet transforms. His current research work on biofluid dynamics of the cardiovasculature, rheology of biological fluids and applications of wavelet transforms has been supported by NSF and the Center for Biomimetics and Bioinspired Engineering (CBBE), GWU.
He developed a wavelet transform-based computational code (PIVlet) for the analysis of complex vortical patterns encountered in arterial blood flow. He has extensive knowledge of experimental fluid mechanics and non-invasive measurement techniques such as laser Doppler velocimetry (LDV), particle image velocimetry (PIV), schlieren imagery, magnetic resonance velocimetry (MRV) and molecular tagging velocimetry (MTV). Dr. Bulusu was recognized with the ASME Best Paper Award by the Advanced Energy Systems Division (AESD) Heat Pump Technical Committee and William and Louise Corcoron Award for contributing to the intellectual and social life of the School of Engineering and Applied Science, GWU.


  Campus Address: SEH 3640
Email: bulusu at gwu dot edu

title: Instruction Team
text:
Rutvik Solanki (Professional Assistant)



Meet Rutvik, a grad student from Computer Science. Rutvik began his academic journey in India, completing his undergraduate studies at the Symbiosis Institute of Technology, where he cultivated a strong interest in technology.
Before starting his graduate studies at GWU, Rutvik gained valuable experience as both a Data Scientist intern and a DevOps intern at a dynamic startup. These experiences sharpened his skills and fueled his curiosity about the ever-changing tech landscape.
In addition to his studies, Rutvik is committed to maintaining the CS1010 course website, believing that a well-structured online platform enhances the learning experience for fellow students. Feel free to reach out and join him on this exciting journey!

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Windows
text: This guide will walk you through the process of installing and setting up RealVNC on your Windows computer to enable remote desktop access.

title: RealVNC Installation Guide for Windows
text:
Prerequisites
Before you begin, ensure you meet the following requirements:

A Windows computer running a supported version of Windows (e.g., Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7).
Internet access.


1. Download RealVNC
Open your web browser and go to the RealVNC website at https://www.realvnc.com/en/connect/download/combined/. Click on the “Download VNC Viewer” button.



Download VNC Viewer




2. Install VNC Viewer
Locate the downloaded installer file (e.g., VNC-Viewer-*.exe) and double-click it to run the installer. Once the installation is complete, click “Finish” to exit the installer.



Open Installer





Run Installer




3. Follow Installation Wizard
The installation wizard will guide you through the installation process. Click on “Customize installation” and “Deselect RealVNC Server” and hit “Install”.



Customize Installation





Deselect RealVNC Server




4. Launch RealVNC Viewer
Once the installation is complete, you can launch RealVNC Viewer by clicking on the “Launch” button or launch it from Start. If prompted to Log in/Sign Up hit “Cancel”, you’re NOT REQUIRED to sign up.



Open RealVNC





Don’t Sign up

title: Installing an Editor
text:
In the world of programming, an editor is more than just a text processor. It’s your creative workspace where you bring your code to life. Here are some key aspects of code editors:

Text Editing: At its core, an editor allows you to write, edit, and organize code in various programming languages. It provides features like syntax highlighting, auto-indentation, and code completion to enhance your coding experience.
Code Execution: Some editors, like Jupyter Notebook, not only allow you to write code but also execute it in an interactive and step-by-step manner. This is especially useful for data analysis and experimentation.
Extensions and Plugins: Code editors are highly customizable. You can enhance their functionality by installing extensions or plugins tailored to your needs. For example, you can add Python-specific tools or themes to make your editor visually appealing.
Integrated Development Environments (IDEs): Some editors, such as Visual Studio Code (VS Code), go beyond text editing and offer a complete integrated development environment with debugging capabilities, version control integration, and more.
Collaboration: Many editors support collaborative coding, allowing multiple programmers to work on the same codebase simultaneously, which is crucial for group projects.


The following tools will help you throughout this workshop, helping you write, execute, and code effectively. Select the appropriate option for your operating system, follow the installation instructions, and dive into the world of coding with confidence!







Step 1: Install Real VNC



Step 2: Connect to the Raspberry Pi







Step 1: Install Real VNC



Step 2: Connect to the Raspberry Pi


Choose the option that best suits your needs and follow the respective installation instructions.
Once you have an editor installed, you can start writing and running your code. Happy coding!
Also, once you’ve finished installation Steps 1 and 2, fill out the Installation Check-In form. 





Content on this webpage was partially generated using ChatGPT.

title: Agenda
text:
Important





The workshop requires that you bring your own personal machine to participate with the prerequisites installed.
You personal machine should be able to connect to the WiFi network provided at the location.
Tech support is not provided unless there are minor issues that could be sorted out.

We prefer that your computer

should be a laptop, with either MacOS 12+ or Windows 10+ operating system
has a standard US keyboard layout i.e, a QWERTY keyboard.

The QWERTY (pronounced KWEHR-tee) keyboard is the standard typewriter and computer keyboard in countries that use a Latin-based alphabet.

title: Learning Objectives
text:
Demonstrate familiarity with key concepts in a procedural programming language such as: variables, control structures, functions, input and output.
Demonstrate the ability to use programming to solve problems appropriate to a beginning class in programming.
Acquire familiarity with how programming can be applied to solve problems.
